source: sf.gov DBI — Floodplain Management Requirements, Soft Story Retrofit
description: Floodplain compliance requirements and mandatory soft story seismic retrofit program

both_required: Property located within FEMA FIRM Flood Hazard zone
Project involves new construction OR costs exceed 50% of structure's market value
triggers.check_method: Property Information Map → Environmental Information tab → Flooding: FEMA FIRM Flood Hazards (Coastal)
triggers.note: Stormwater flood zones alone do NOT trigger requirements

before_permit_approval: Completed Flood Hazard Zone Protection Checklist (page 5, attachment A of Info Sheet G-28)
Checklist signed and stamped by CA-licensed engineer or architect
before_occupancy_certificate: FEMA Flood-proofing Certificate (if using dry flood-proofing methods)

floodplain.construction_standards: Projects must be elevated above floodwaters or flood-proofed, and must not cause physical damage to neighboring properties during flooding
floodplain.exemptions: DBI and SF Planning may modify requirements for historic structures, water-dependent facilities, or exceptional hardships (case-by-case)

soft_story.description: Mandatory seismic upgrade program for specific wood-frame multi-family buildings
soft_story.affected_buildings: Wood-frame multi-family buildings on mandatory Soft Story property list
soft_story.eligibility_check: Search DBI's Soft Story property list

steps.title: Verify eligibility
steps.detail: Check if building is on mandatory Soft Story property list

steps.title: Submit applications
steps.detail: OTC permit application + Green Building forms at Permit Center

steps.title: Address plan revisions
steps.detail: Update plans per plan check comments, coordinate with assigned plan checker

steps.title: Pay fees and begin work
steps.detail: 3-4.5% of construction cost. Get job card before starting.

soft_story.tax_incentive: Seismic retrofit may qualify for CA property tax exclusion — file claim with Assessor's Office before or within 30 days of completion
